content: dorna is a comfortable pair of socks with an all over ribbed texture worked cuff down with a folded stockinette cuff and german short row heel they make a squishy accessory that can be worn as house socks **yarn ** you will need about 400 m 438 yds of fingering weight sock yarn the sample was knit using lana grossa meilenweit seta 400 m 437 yds / 100 g in 31 **needles ** 2 5 mm us 1 5 circular needles or dpns or size required to get gauge note that these socks are intended to be worn with a looser fit than regular snug socks i recommend that you go up a needle size compared to your usual sock knitting **gauge ** 30 sts x 60 rnds per 10 cm 4 in texture pattern after blocking **sizes ** the pattern is written for a 54 62 / 70 / 78 stitch count 18 20 5 / 23 / 26 cm 7 8 / 9 / 10 ¼ finished circumference measure your foot at its widest point under the toes and choose a size closest to your measurement the rib texture will result in a plump stretchy fabric allowing it to fit comfortably with a wider ease range **notions ** tapestry needle and scissors stitch markers row counter recommended **techniques used ** socks are knit cuff down folded stockinette cuff all over mistake rib pattern using knit and purl sts german short row heel rounded toe with simple decreases while maintaining pattern grafting pattern includes charted and written instructions
